channel.title: New website - Little old :)
channel.description:
I made this website for easier to find item ids for private servers - It is probably people who are on 508 servers +, that uses this most..
[b][u]Features:[/u][/b]
[ul][li]Search for item [b]names[/b] and find the id.[/li][/ul]
[b][u]Soon(maybe) features:[/u][/b]
[ul][li]Fix a bug: When you type 2 item names or more, it only uses the last one to find items with.[/li] [li]Hopefully item images next to the item id's.[/li] [li]Make something where people can add new items, I have to approve to make it easier for me to update this.[/li][/ul]
Hmm, don't know what else to say? :) By the way, I don't know if it's secured, but please [b]report[/b] to me if there are some bugs, like where you can get my mysql connection etc.
[url=http://itemdb.co.nr][img]http://i40.tinypic.com/opz0d4.png[/img][/url]

item.title: New website - Little old :)
item.dc:creator: @communist communist
item.description:
@communist wrote:

[quote=“xKadir, post:25, topic:279413”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=368730.msg2799447#msg2799447 date=1243280678]
So just return an image of a note if the remote image does not exist.
[/quote][quote author=communist link=topic=368730.msg2800365#msg2800365 date=1243350432]
Offer all of the pic types in a table:
Make a script that’ll grab the image from the RS site and display it. If there is no image, show a message.
[/quote]

How would I do, to check if there is an image or not?[/quote]
Example:

$items = array(1, 2, 9, 11);
foreach ($arr as &$value) {
    if (!strpos(file_get_contents("http://itemdb-rs.runescape.com/2640_obj_sprite.gif?id={$value}"), "Sorry, the page you were looking for was not found.")) {
        //404, no image.
        echo "Sorry, this image wasn't found!";
    } else {
        //Image is there
        echo "<img src='http://itemdb-rs.runescape.com/2640_obj_sprite.gif?id={$value}' />";
    }
}

Untested, wrote in the reply box. Should work.

This will use a lot of bandwidth though :).

Read full topic

item.description:
@xKadir wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:20, topic:279413”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=368730.msg2796322#msg2796322 date=1243094150]
It’s not hard to get all the images, you could just take them straight from the runescape item db? The url is the same for all items, just a different id.

^ http://itemdb-rs.runescape.com/2640_obj_big.gif?id=60
[/quote]

http://itemdb-rs.runescape.com/2640_obj_sprite.gif?id=60
sprite looks better.[/quote]

I could use this method, BUT not all items have a sprite on itemdb-rs.runescape.com. Only tradeable items are there.

item.title: New website - Little old :)
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“Server-Unknown.Net, post:11, topic:279413”]Did [b]you[/u] really make this? Because I have seen this website a long time ago - actually like a few months back - while playing one of my favourite servers ‘Thugscape’.

I have used this site many times still, but I on the urge of disbelief that you made this, sorry. Main reason I’m saying this though is: Why so late to release this here???[/quote]
He said he would remove it, and he removed it, doesn’t that prove something?
Unless of course, the cursor were still there when you looked.

Read full topic

I have used this site many times still, but I on the urge of disbelief that you made this, sorry. Main reason I’m saying this though is: Why so late to release this here???[/quote]

Don’t know. Really made this.

[quote=“Holic, post:12, topic:279413”]CURSOR STILL THURR
Also, why not add images.[/quote]

Is the cursor still there? - Also it will take looooooong time to collect ALL the item images.

[quote=“Halogenisation, post:1, topic:279591”]Aww c’mon guys I kinda liked the cursor… gave it authenticity.

However using JavaScript for simple rollover effects is a little pointless ;)[/quote]

I liked it too, but it does get annoying sometimes

  • What should I use instead of the rollover effects, other than JavaScript? (Was fast made)
    EDIT: Oh, you mean I could have used CSS, like this:

#searchbtn{ background-image: url(images/searchbtn.png)} #searchbtn:hover{ background-image: url(images/searchbtnhover.png)}
